text: The 1939 Washington State Cougars football team was an American football team that represented Washington State College during the 1939 college football season. Head coach Babe Hollingbery led the team to a 3–5 mark in the PCC and 4–5 overall. ==Schedule== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" |- ! scope="col" | Date ! scope="col" | Opponent ! scope="col" | Location ! scope="col" | Score ! scope="col" | Attendance |- ! scope="row" | September 23 | Gonzaga | Home | 19-6 W | 9,000 |- ! scope="row" | October 7 | USC | Away | 0-27 L | 45,000 |- ! scope="row" | October 14 | Washington | Home | 6-0 W | 18,000 |- ! scope="row" | October 21 | California | Away | 7-13 L | 35,000 |- ! scope="row" | October 28 | Oregon State (15) | Away | 0-13 L | 8,000 |- ! scope="row" | November 4 | Oregon | Away | 0-38 L | 2,800 |- ! scope="row" | November 11 | Idaho | Home | 21-13 W | 12,000 |- ! scope="row" | November 18 | Stanford | Away | 7-0 W | 6,000 |- ! scope="row" | November 30 | UCLA (13) | Away | 7-24 L | 25,000 |} ==References== Washington State Category:Washington State Cougars football seasons Category:1939 in Washington (state)
